raw_claims:
```json
{
    "claims": [
        {
            "claim_id": 1,
            "claim_text": "The study compares several methods of domain adaptation to augment a small French dataset with a larger English dataset for the task of automatically distinguishing participants with dementia from controls.",
            "location": "Abstract",
            "claim_type": "Methodology",
            "exact_quote": "Here, we compare several methods of domain adaptation to augment a small French dataset of picture descriptions (n = 57) with a much larger English dataset (n = 550), for the task of automatically distinguishing participants with dementia from controls."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 2,
            "claim_text": "The authors introduce a new set of features to model the order in which information units are produced by dementia patients and controls, which improves classification performance in both English and French.",
            "location": "Abstract",
            "claim_type": "Methodology",
            "exact_quote": "information units, we introduce a new set of features to model the order in which information units are produced by dementia patients and controls."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 3,
            "claim_text": "The best result (AUC = 0.89) is achieved using the multilingual training set with a combination of information and language model features.",
            "location": "Abstract",
            "claim_type": "Result",
            "exact_quote": "the best result (AUC = 0.89) is achieved using the multilingual training set with a combination of information and language model features."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 4,
            "claim_text": "The study identifies a set of features that are both useful for the detection of dementia and that transfer across different languages.",
            "location": "Introduction",
            "claim_type": "Result",
            "exact_quote": "to identify a set of features that are both useful for the detection of dementia and that we expect to transfer across different languages"
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 5,
            "claim_text": "The study shows that domain adaptation can improve classification performance in French by incorporating English data.",
            "location": "Results",
            "claim_type": "Result",
            "exact_quote": "For French, the LM features generally do not benefit from domain adaptation, with equivalent or poorer AUC relative to the unilingual case. The best result with the LM features is achieved in the AUGMENT scenario, where the classifier can select the French LM features only."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 6,
            "claim_text": "The study demonstrates that naively combining features in the ALL condition led to better results than the AUGMENT algorithm.",
            "location": "Results",
            "claim_type": "Result",
            "exact_quote": "naively combining features in the ALL condition led to better results than the AUGMENT algorithm."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 7,
            "claim_text": "The study finds that the multilingual approach can be equally effective, given a large enough corpus.",
            "location": "Results",
            "claim_type": "Result",
            "exact_quote": "the cross-lingual approach can be equally effective, given a large enough corpus."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 8,
            "claim_text": "The study develops a new set of features for this task, using concept-based language modelling, which improved AUC from 0.80 to 0.85 in the unilingual case, and 0.88 to 0.89 in the multilingual case.",
            "location": "Results",
            "claim_type": "Methodology",
            "exact_quote": "We also developed a new set of features for this task, using concept-based language modelling, which improved AUC from 0.80 to 0.85 in the unilingual case, and 0.88 to 0.89 in the multilingual case."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 9,
            "claim_text": "The study suggests that the ALL configuration is optimal in both French and English, leading to a language-agnostic classifier.",
            "location": "Discussion",
            "claim_type": "Conclusion",
            "exact_quote": "the ALL configuration is optimal in both French and English."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 10,
            "claim_text": "The study finds that the multilingual approach can be equally effective, given a large enough corpus.",
            "location": "Discussion",
            "claim_type": "Conclusion",
            "exact_quote": "the cross-lingual approach can be equally effective, given a large enough corpus."
        },
        {
            "claim_id": 11,
            "claim_text": "The study suggests that future work could involve extending the set of features, incorporating data from other languages, and testing the techniques for detecting earlier stages of cognitive decline.",
            "location": "Discussion",
            "claim_type": "Future Work",
            "exact_quote": "Future work will involve extending the set of features involved, incorporating data from other languages, and testing whether similar techniques can be effective for detecting earlier stages of cognitive decline."
        }
    ]
}
```
